name: Pits of Fire

pages.text: $(thing)Fire$() is an important technological advancement. In order to create fire, you will need a $(thing)Firestarter$(). In order to use, simply hold $(thing)$(k:key.use)$() down on the ground. After a few moments, smoke, and then fire will be created. It may take a couple tries to light successfully.
Crafting a firestarter can be done with two sticks.

With a firestarter, it is now possible to make a $(thing)Firepit$(). In order to make one, you will need one $(thing)log$(), three $(thing)sticks$(), and optionally up to three pieces of $(thing)kindling$(). Kindling can be items such as paper, straw, or other items, and will increase the chance of successfully creating a firepit. Throw ($(thing)$(k:key.drop)$()) all the items on the ground, on the same block. Then use the firestarter on the block with the items floating above it.
pages.title: Firepit

pages.text: If you were successful, a firepit will be created.

Using the firepit again will now open the firepit screen. On the left are four $(thing)fuel$() slots. Logs, Peat, and Stick Bundles can all be used as firepit fuel by placing them in the topmost slot. Fuel will be consumed from the bottommost slot. There is a gauge which displays the current $(thing)Temperature$() of the firepit, and on the right, a slot for items to be $(l:heating)heated$() in.
